X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=197581214; y=0Z-anV4xBNTiVnSryVVzRFwae9S3A2bJMifaOBtgAqMc8H8

OOC: OK no problem.  My character is paranoid anyway.

BIC:

After a few more minutes of running, he reached the center of the
city.  Not wanting to rush out into the open unprepared, he stayed at
the end of the alleyway and surveiled the area.

On 2/7/08, khamkain <kham31@...> wrote:
> Razorwing left the base with great haste without noticing what Deadfur
> was doing.
>
> Razorwing was flying high above the bot while his troups were getting
> ready to made a attack from behind with the bravo team and from the
> front with the alpha team. He was waiting to get a good chance to act.
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "khamkain" <kham31@...> wrote:
> >
> > Razorwing: That's what I was thinking. Let cut the source of the
> > problem first then we will deal with the insurrection. (As he open a
> > comlink) Alpha and Bravo team take a shuttle and meet with me on this
> > location (he sent the last known location of ultra magnum)
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <warriorazure@> wrote:
> > >
> > > OOC: Kraftlos, FYI, Deadfur is talking about Ultra Magnum.
> > >
> > > BIC:
> > >
> > > Deadfur was in a bad situation. He didn't like the prospect of facing
> > > something he doesn't know about, but leaving the problem unattended
> > > might be worse in the long run.
> > >
> > > Deadfur: I... Ah, dammit... Listen, you send your elite squad and who
> > > knows what's going to happen? There have been demonstrations...
> > > violent demonstrations. People don't like what the Iron Skulls did and
> > > they like even less the way we handled the situation. For some reason,
> > > I think our Mr. Mystery is behind that. You draw your own conclusions,
> > > but that's what I think.
> > >
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "khamkain" <kham31@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Razorwing: Any other suggestion? We have a treat in this city
> AGAIN. I
> > > > do not want to take any chance with this guy. If you have
> something to
> > > > tell it's now or i'll call my elite squad and we're off.
> > > >
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <warriorazure@> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > Deadfur: Yeah I'm ready. I like your plan, actually. It's like,
> > "Hey,
> > > > > big guy, welcome to the neighborhood! Here's an energon pie!
> > Hope you
> > > > > enjoy the new place!". I mean what's he supposed to be? He's been
> > > > > raising civil unrest and we have no clue why. I wouldn't go up
> front
> > > > > to him, but you're the chief around.
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "khamkain" <kham31@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > ooc: It should be ok from now on and i'll try to made a repost
> > > of the
> > > > > > discution with remus and kup
> > > > > >
> > > > > > bic: As Razorwing was hearing the situation from Deadfure, one
> > > of his
> > > > > > general came to his ear.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > General: We have a stealth expert following this bot. What
> should
> > > > we do?
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Razorwing : Nothing for now : keep your distance before I met
> > > with him
> > > > > > and we should be doing so rigth now. Ready Deadfure?
> > > > > >
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <warriorazure@> wrote:
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Ultra Magnum turned back. He'd thought he heard something, but
> > > > didn't
> > > > > > > have anything to confirm it. By now, someone should have heard
> > > about
> > > > > > > him. There must be some watch being done on him. He grinned
> > slyly.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > He took a step back, then transformed. He started rolling
> > slowly,
> > > > > > > intent on leaving this part of town to visit the slums on the
> > > north
> > > > > > > side. Just in case, a small round orb popped up on the back
> > of his
> > > > > > > trailer. He would see if somebody was behind him...
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > Following an alleyway, he reached the crossing of a major
> > > roadway,
> > > > > > > > Not seeing any cars, he sneaked accross the road only to
> > > find the
> > > > > > > > alleyways on that side were walled off.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > The autobot stepped back and transformed into flight
> mode.  He
> > > > then
> > > > > > > > flew over the wall and past a few buildings.  Not wanting to
> > > > > draw too
> > > > > > > > much attention, he flew up on top of a taller building, then
> > > > > > > > transformed back into robot mode.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > He was surprised that he hadnt been bothered yet.  Why did
> > > > this city
> > > > > > > > seem so empty?  Perhaps they were all hiding?
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > From his perch, he began to scan the surrounding area for
> > > signals.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > On 1/19/08, Kraftlos <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > The Autobot hovered over the edge of Relay City and
> > > > > transformed into
> > > > > > > > > robot mode.  Like a trained soldier, he imediately
> moved to
> > > > > > cover and
> > > > > > > > > sneaked through the nearest gate into the city.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Trying not to be seen, he immediately found a secluded
> > > space to
> > > > > > walk;
> > > > > > > > > where he could move without being seen.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > OOC: I'm hoping he can either encounter residents or other
> > > > > maximals,
> > > > > > > > > but I guess anyone would be fine.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > On 1/10/08, Nic <warriorazure@> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > Hatred.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Over time, I found out that, on top of being a deep
> > feeling,
> > > > > it is
> > > > > > > > > > also a terribly useful tool. Sharing that hatred makes
> > > > > people see
> > > > > > > > > > things you own way, and such an agreement is the
> beginning
> > > > of an
> > > > > > > alliance.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > ********************************
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Magnum had been in relay for some time now. Despite his
> > > > massive
> > > > > > > > > > appearance, he managed to stay hidden most of the time.
> > > He was
> > > > > > > vaguely
> > > > > > > > > > known, asa rumor in the hoodlums of the city.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Little by little, he approached Silver Wings
> > throughout the
> > > > > > city. He
> > > > > > > > > > spoke with them, listened to them. They had been ravaged
> > > > by the
> > > > > > > > > > uprising the Iron Skulls had lead and viewed Jotunn's
> > > demotion
> > > > > > as a
> > > > > > > > > > candy punishment. The perpetrators, the soldiers
> > > > themselves, had
> > > > > > > > > > barely been chastised for that, and resentment was
> strong
> > > > > > because of
> > > > > > > > > > this inaction among the surviving population.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > He agreed with them, and told them they should get even
> > > in one
> > > > > > > way or
> > > > > > > > > > another. Like a prophet, people took him to heart and
> > > > remembered
> > > > > > > him.
> > > > > > > > > > He was hope for the wounded, the hope of recovery and
> > > > > > vengeance. He
> > > > > > > > > > only asked them not to speak directly of him. His
> > influence
> > > > > > grew by
> > > > > > > > > > the cycle.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > *********************************
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Intelligence reports had been scarce inside the city.
> > > Deadfur
> > > > > > didn't
> > > > > > > > > > like that. They'd lost contacts there, and he'd
> decided to
> > > > > stay to
> > > > > > > > > > help rebuilding
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > When an agent told him someone looking like the missing
> > > > Sergeant
> > > > > > > Ultra
> > > > > > > > > > Magnus was talking of getting back at the Iron Skulls
> > in the
> > > > > > > people's
> > > > > > > > > > area, that worried him. But, he didn't want to take
> > > > decisions on
> > > > > > > that
> > > > > > > > > > himself. He went to Razorwing and handed him the datapad
> > > that
> > > > > > > > > > contained the report.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Deafur: What d'you make of that? Should we worry?
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > >
> > > >
> > >
> >
>
>
>
